oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The effect of pre-crop and fertilization on baking quality of organic spring wheat
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Väisänen, Jaana
Pihala, Marjo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Soil structure more than previous crop seemed to influence the development of organic spring wheat during the extremely wet growing season in 1998. However, the best soil structures and strongest wheat crops were found after clover leys and the poorest after peas. The most important determinant for the baking quality of the flour was the cultivar.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Väisänen, Jaana and Pihala, Marjo (1999) The effect of pre-crop and fertilization on baking quality of organic spring wheat. Paper at: NJF congress no. 21, Ås, Norway, 28 June - 1 July 1999.
